title: Matrices as Functions - rotation of image

content.question: Neither axis has a scale or tick marks. A circle is graphed with its center at the origin. A star with five points is shown outside the circle, with two points of the star touching the circle. The star is just above the x axis and labeled Preimage. A segment extends from the lower point of the star that intersects the circle to the origin. Another star with five points, congruent to the other star, is shown outside the circle, with two points touching the circle. The star is just to the right of the y axis and labeled Image. A segment extends from the right point of the star that intersects the circle to the origin. The angle between the two segments from the stars to the origin has a measure labeled pi over 3. The figure shows the preimage and image of a linear transformation <math alttext="L"><mi>L</mi></math>. The linear transformation function <math alttext="L"><mi>L</mi></math> is given by <math alttext="L open parentheses vector v close parentheses equals A times vector v"><mi>L</mi><mfenced><mover><mi>v</mi><mo>→</mo></mover></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mi>A</mi><mover><mi>v</mi><mo>→</mo></mover></math>, where <math alttext="A"><mi>A</mi></math> is a <math alttext="2 by 2"><mn>2</mn><mo>×</mo><mn>2</mn></math> matrix and <math alttext="vector v"><mover><mi>v</mi><mo>→</mo></mover></math> is a column vector. Which of the following could define <math alttext="A"><mi>A</mi></math> ?
